attributes.action: Cancel the Three-week delay of A-levels: Reduce content or cancel A-level exams
attributes.additional_details: The delay in A-level examinations by three weeks does not make up for over 5 months of missed in person learning as well as the continued self-isolations many people (teachers and students alike) continue to have to take. I prompt you to bring this outrage from young people to the forefront of this governments mind. As we have received a consistent negligence towards young people's issues and we've had enough.
attributes.background: The Government must cancel A-levels 2021 or reduce the content due to the disadvantage that students in this academic class has had because of the pandemic. A three week delay does not make up for 6 months lost teaching and the strain on mental health due to the repercussions of failed leadership.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Do not delay A-level Exams: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/549995

Cancel GCSEs and A Levels in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326066

Reduce curriculum content for year 10 & 12 students who will sit exams in 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320772
